data.title: Delicious pho noodle soups @ affordable prices
data.text: We were greeted & welcomed immediately upon arrival; received prompted service; ordered hot Vietnamese coffee; refreshing Thai ice tea; fried egg rolls; pho noodles with meatballs & vegetarian pho noodles.  Clean restaurant & restroom.  Relaxing atmosphere with comfortable seats.  No outdoor seats.  Our waitress was courteous & patient to obtain our orders.  Our foods & drinks were appetizing; served @ right temperatures; tasted delicious; served in generous quantity.  We recommend everyone to visit pho vn for delicious pho noodle soups & will certainly return.

data.title: pho-sure delicious
data.text:
This is so pho-sure delicious...thanks fellow Yelpers for pointing me here!

I went here for lunch with no real expectations but with a hope that based on other reviews I might find a diamond...boy did I ever.

Aesthetically  it's a small storefront in a strip mall. Inside it's 7-8 tables and booths with an open kitchen.

The staff here are very nice, always smiling and truly trying to please everyone. I had the pho #17 with meatballs and round steak. A huge plate of spouts, various peppers, fresh basil and lime were brought out to make your personalize your pho.

The broth and noodles were delicious. Everything tasted fresh, was hot and it was a large portion that filled me up. At $9, I felt like it was a good bang-for-my buck. It's close to work and I can see it becoming a regular of my lunch circuit.

Definately worthwhile!

user_location.name: West Palm Beach, Florida, United States

data.title: Thank god!  Another tiny strip mall surprise!  Amazing Pho!!
data.text: Found this hidden gem inside of a strip mall off Congress Ave.  Small place, but the smell is authentic vietnamese as soon as you walk in!  Wait staff is very friendly and I even overheard some other patrons complimenting them on their food and customer service!  I did not have a lot of time, so I ordered the Pho Beef special with no tripe.  Now everyone that knows Pho, knows that it's the soup that makes or breaks this dish.  And Pho VN's soup base did not disappoint!!  You could tell the stock was prepared for hours and hours just based on the intense layers of flavors that hit your palate.  The noodles were also very good as well as the beef pieces.  Tender and soft, but not too overcooked that things turn into mush once you try picking them up with your chopsticks.  I can't wait to go back and try out some more stuff!!!

data.title: Deserves a 3 + for their Pho and Egg Noodle Soups
data.text:
I just returned from a trip that included asian cuisine in NYC's Chinatown and Flushing Queens.   As many of you know, South Florida is in another league of asian cuisine ( think minors - farm team - at best !! ).
That being said... The Veggie Pho as well as the Seafood Egg and Rice Noodle Soups were better than SoFlo average - particularly the flavorful broths. The Calamari fried appy was good as well ... Servers were very pleasant and the decor was pleasing as well..
Not a bad choice for Palm Beach County.. If you can't go to Fort Lauderdale or NYC !!

data.title: Good food, quick service
data.text: A great spot for lunch, I haven't been here for dinner.  The egg rolls are really tasty, highly recommended.  I've had the pho, which is good though I usually get the pan seared steak and fries rice (#35), which is excellent.  Staff is friendly and attentive.

data.title: nice small thai restaurant
data.text: We went for a change of pace, the food was excellent,we had spring rolls with peanut sauce, pad thai,pan fried noodle[ a pretty healthy dish of mixed veg and seafood. service was okay ,water was refilled promptly. prices were moderate. it was decorated in thai fashion. booths were comfortable. the only thing i can complain about is any time i eat thai and i'm hungry i need to order two dishes, all the thai restaurants i've gone too give small portions.so dont go in starving.

data.title: A very nice neighborhood Viet Namese restaurant
data.text: To be honest, while the food was inconsistent for our first few visits, it has become consistently good over the last three visits. The owner and family do attend to you very closely and meet your every need. Food is all made fresh and from fresh ingredients. Yum!

data.title: Fantastic Pho and Sensational Spring Rolls
data.text: This small restaurant serves fresh beautifully handmade Spring Rolls with a peanut dipping sauce that rocked our world so much that we enjoyed a double order! The staff is warm and friendly and the Chef knows what he is doing.  I had Chicken Pad Thai with fresh crunchy sprouts and thoroughly enjoyed every bite.  My husband has had Pho all over Florida and he says that the Pho here is the best around. It comes with a side platter of fresh basil, lime wedges, jalapenos and a pile of fresh crunchy sprouts.  This food is just what the Doctor ordered.

data.title: Pad Thai or Fried Rice, Very Nice
data.text: Great flavors. Sweet, savory and of course, spicy food in a pleasant atmosphere.This is  a small, family owned business in the strip mall next to a Dollar Tree. Hour food is prepared fresh to order. The Pho, a hot and very spicy soup, comes in a huge bowl. The $15 Pad Thai (I had 5 kind of large shrimp) and the fried rice (Better than Chinese) are really good but the portions are more lunch sized. You won't be overstuffed or need a doggy bag.

data.title: Still a good Pho restaurant
data.text: I did a very good review for the Pho ( a vietnamese soup meal) last year and on my trip to Boynton Beach this year I try this restaurant again. Their Pho is still good but i noticed that the quality is a little bit not as good as last year. The soup stock is less good for reason i don't know what. Maybe the chef use less beef soup bone or he does not simmer 24 hours long the stock as he used to do. Also for a 9$ soup bowl, he should put more rice noodle and more tender meat. On my second visit this year, i tried the meat and tendon and find the tendon a little bit hard-not cooked enough. These should be simmered at least 4 hours and not just 1 or 2. Those are the reason why 3 stars and not 5. Hope he reads this.

data.title: Pho Vntastic!
data.text: This was our first visit but surely won't be our last. The service and atmosphere was fantastic! The food was delicious from appetizers to desserts. I highly recommend the jasmine tea, spring rolls and the fried bananas. This place is truly authentic and not to be missed!

data.title: Rude
data.text: The food wasnt bad but our server was so nasty it was unbelievable. We ordered spring rolls and when they came out they were very different than we have ever had them. We didnt like them we were going to pay for them since there was nothing wrong with them- we just didnt care for them. The waitress came over basically scolding us and said dont order something you dont like because now im responsible for it. Just her attitude we could do with out. So because there is an asian restaurant on every corner... We wont go back.

data.title: Awesome Pho
data.text:
I was in Florida visiting my daughter in January.  We went to several new places and one was Pho VN in Boynton Beach.  It is located on a strip mall.  We had the chicken Pho (pronounced Fah), calamari, and egg rolls.  EVERYTHING  was wonderful.   The Pho was soo very tasty and with the basil, jalapeños and bean sprouts added...sooo good.  It would be a perfect soup if you are ailing.

I would so recommend you try this place. 
I'm glad my daughter took me there to try it.

data.title: Yum Yum
data.text:
While shopping in the plaza I caught a glimpse of Pho and thought no cooking tonight. We ordered pork meatballs wrapped in rice paper, very light and weird looking - good taste. The calamari was large rings with a sweet plum sauce, loved the sweet fried combination. Pad thai with beef and beef rice noodle were both excellent. The flavors were great and I mixed them together,  yummy! Special pho soup was very spicy was the best he had in florida. We brought a Thai newbie and she loved it! It was so good we forgot to take pictures, lol
Reasonable prices, cute place, 8 tables plus some outside. This is definitely a return trip soon.

data.title: Enjoyable Vietnamese Cuisine
data.text:
Writing this review after several trips...  to get a better feel for the place.  I've tried several appetizers - all were good (beef salad, papaya salad, wings, etc.)  The pho is decent.  But I'm really fond of their vermicelli bowls.  Pretty darn good with bright fresh flavors.  Also, the place is very reasonably priced.

The place itself is a bit "dive-y" but the service is usually very friendly and hospitable.  Its usually always busy which is a good sign.  Its worth a shot for good, fresh, cheap eats.

data.title: Excellent
data.text:
Enjoyable place, clean. Limited in space but excellent in the way the waitress treated us. 

Food is typical Vietnamese. 

Not only enjoyed the food. As we were leaving i we experienced the restaurant's owner taking food to homeless people in the parking

A restaurant like this and a exemplary owner, deserves the best. We got the best

data.title: Truly Enjoyable
data.text:
Our reserved table was waiting for us when our group of six arrived.  This was a first visit for all of us.  The interior décor was warm add appealing, not really expected from the mundane appearance of this shopping center.
We were warmly greeted, and had all of our questions answered.
The spring rolls were delicious and the peanut sauce was superb.  The pho was very tasty with excellent noodles and broth.  Our green curry was rich in flavor, but not overbearing.
Service was good.  The restaurant filled up completely after our arrival, and may have overwhelmed the wait staff, but eventually, our water glasses were refilled and extra napkins brought to the table.
Pacing of the dinner was very good.  Our dishes arrived as we finished the previous courses.
We are anxious to return to sample some more dishes.

data.title: Delicious
data.text: We found this gem online and it was excellent. There was 4 of us and we had the Pho, Pad Thai and vermicelli meal. The service was great, all the ladies were very helpful in giving suggestions. Just amazing food and Quality!! The best waitress is Patenanee

data.title: Enjoyable but a little bit boring
data.text:
My wife and I visited here for a late dinner and were treated to very polite and efficient service, the food however seemed to fall a bit flat. It was good, but that's about where it stops.

We've recently been to Pho and have had it several places and when it's done right it's fantastic (not just good). The depth of flavors should be such that every bite is an adventure. Well the Pho here was just boring the only adventure was what flavor can I add with the condiments and veggies.

It was good enough that we may go back if we're in the area, but our expectation certainly won't be very high.

data.title: Quick Lunch
data.text:
A small and cozy place. Lunch on a Sunday and the place was not busy. Service is friendly and helpful. 
Dishes are on the small side but delicious!
